question: [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/config.move] [Function: set_primary_oracle_provider()] [Invariant: Provider State] Can primary provider be set to a value that doesn't exist in oracle_provider_configs table? (Critical)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/config.move] [Function: set_secondary_oracle_provider()] [Invariant: Provider Distinctness] Is there enforcement that primary and secondary must be different? Can setting secondary = primary break fallback logic? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/config.move] [Function: keep_history_update()] [Invariant: History Monotonicity] Is there any enforcement that history.updated_time must increase monotonically? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/config.move] [Function: new_price_feed()] [Invariant: Feed Uniqueness] Can the same coin_type have multiple price feeds with different oracle_ids? Is this intended behavior? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/config.move] [Function: set_oracle_provider_config_enable()] [Invariant: Active Provider] If primary provider's config is disabled (after checking line 447), can this break active price updates? (Critical)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/config.move] [Functions: set_price_diff_threshold1/set_price_diff_threshold2] [Cross-Function Race] If threshold1 and threshold2 are being updated concurrently, can the invariant threshold1 <= threshold2 be temporarily violated? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/config.move] [Functions: set_minimum_effective_price/set_maximum_effective_price] [Cross-Function Race] Can minimum and maximum effective prices become inverted through concurrent updates? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/config.move] [Functions: set_primary_oracle_provider/set_oracle_provider_config_enable] [Cross-Function Race] Can primary provider be set while its config is being disabled? (Critical)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/config.move] [Functions: new_oracle_provider_config/set_primary_oracle_provider] [Cross-Function Timing] Can primary be set to a provider before its config is created? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/config.move] [Functions: keep_history_update/set_historical_price_ttl] [Cross-Function Consistency] If TTL is changed while history is being updated, can this cause timestamp validation issues? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/config.move] [Functions: start_or_continue_diff_threshold2_timer/set_max_duration_within_thresholds] [Cross-Function Coordination] If max_duration changes while timer is running, can duration checks be bypassed? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/config.move] [Function: new_price_feed()] [Edge Case: All Zero Parameters] What happens if all threshold parameters are set to 0 during creation? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/config.move] [Function: new_price_feed()] [Edge Case: Max Parameters] What if all parameters are set to their maximum values (u64::MAX, u256::MAX)? Can this cause overflow? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/config.move] [Function: is_price_feed_exists()] [Edge Case: Empty vec_feeds] What happens if vec_feeds is empty? Does the function handle this correctly? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/config.move] [Function: set_oracle_id_to_price_feed()] [Edge Case: Last Feed] If the feed being updated is the last one in vec_feeds, does the iteration logic work correctly? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/config.move] [Function: get_history_price_data_from_feed()] [Edge Case: Uninitialized History] If history was never updated (price=0, updated_time=0), can this cause issues in calculations? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/config.move] [Attack Scenario: Oracle ID Swap] Can an attacker call set_oracle_id_to_price_feed() to swap oracle IDs between two feeds, causing price data to be routed incorrectly? (Critical)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/config.move] [Attack Scenario: Provider Rug Pull] Can a malicious operator set primary provider to a compromised provider, then immediately disable secondary, leaving no fallback? (Critical)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/config.move] [Attack Scenario: Threshold Manipulation] Can an attacker widen thresholds to max values right before price manipulation to avoid detection? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/config.move] [Attack Scenario: Historical Price Poisoning] Can an attacker call keep_history_update() with manipulated prices to corrupt price history? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/config.move] [Attack Scenario: Timer Bypass] Can an attacker call start_or_continue_diff_threshold2_timer() with a very old timestamp, then exploit the max_duration_within_thresholds check? (Critical)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/config.move] [Attack Scenario: Pause DoS] Can an attacker pause the oracle right before a major price update, forcing the vault to use stale prices during high volatility? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/config.move] [Attack Scenario: Feed Spam] Can an attacker create many price feeds to cause vec_feeds to grow unbounded, DoSing all functions that iterate it? (High)
